column2: 我想就在书房炉边消磨一下午，不想踩着杂草污泥到呼啸山庄了。

column1: Yesterday afternoon set in misty and cold.
I had half a mind to spend it by my study fire, instead of wading through heath and mud to Wuthering Heights.

On coming up from dinner, however (N.B. I dine between twelve and one o'clock; the housekeeper, a matronly lady, taken as a fixture along with the house, could not, or would not, comprehend my request that I might be served at five), on mounting the stairs with this lazy intention, and stepping into the room, I saw a servant girl on her knees surrounded by brushes and coal-scuttles, and raising an infernal dust as she extinguished the flames with heaps of cinders.
column2: 但是，吃过午饭（注意――我在十二点与一点钟之间吃午饭，而可以当作这所房子的附属物的管家婆，一位慈祥的太太却不能，或者并不愿理解我请求在五点钟开饭的用意），在我怀着这个懒惰的想法上了楼，迈进屋子的时候，看见一个女仆跪在地上，身边是扫帚和煤斗。
她正在用一堆堆煤渣封火，搞起一片弥漫的灰尘。
这景象立刻把我赶回头了。

column1: This spectacle drove me back immediately; I took my hat, and, after a four-miles' walk, arrived at Heathcliff's garden gate just in time to escape the first feathery flakes of a snow shower.
column2: 我拿了帽子，走了四里路，到达了希刺克厉夫的花园口口，刚好躲过了一场今年初降的鹅毛大雪。

column1: On that bleak hill top the earth was hard with a black frost, and the air made me shiver through every limb.
column2: 在那荒凉的山顶上，土地由于结了一层黑冰而冻得坚硬，冷空气使我四肢发抖。

column1: Being unable to remove the chain, I jumped over, and, running up the flagged causeway bordered with straggling gooseberry bushes, knocked vainly for admittance, till my knuckles tingled and the dogs howled.
column2: 我弄不开门链，就跳进去，顺着两边种着蔓延的醋栗树丛的石路跑去。
我白白地敲了半天门，一直敲到我的手指骨都痛了，狗也狂吠起来。

column1: I ejaculated mentally, `you deserve perpetual isolation from your species for your churlish inhospitality.
column2: 我心里直叫，“只为你这样无礼待客，就该一辈子跟人群隔离。

column1: At least, I would not keep my doors barred in the day time.
column2: 我至少还不会在白天把门闩住。

column1: I don't care--I will get in!'
So resolved, I grasped the latch and shook it vehemently.
column2: 我就抓住门闩，使劲摇它。

column1: Vinegar-faced Joseph projected his head from a round window of the barn.
column2: 苦脸的约瑟夫从谷仓的一个圆窗里探出头来。
